title: Free e-commerce
content:
i have a job which pays me $3.60 an hour it's not much but $40 a fortnight in pocket money is something i'm happy with & it's the occupation that i've always wanted webmaster anyway i working for art unlimited which is part of st.laurence community services & my supervisior has hinted that she wants to open a online shop that accepts cheque & credit card payments but doesn't want to pay for it so does anyone knows of any free e-commerce that i can download & use on the server?

please provide your feedback in this topic
thank you
rorie

Rorie

title: re:
content: Please learn how to use a "full stop" or "period". Reading that post was painful.

title: Re: re:
content:
Nice to hear about the job.
I really have no idea about that e-commerce stuff, but sourceforge.net has something (and that's free):
[url=http://sourceforge.net/search/?type_of_search=soft&words=e-commerce]sourceforge.net/search/?t...e-commerce[/url]

No idea how to use or install them however, and likely it's not that simple. But not sure.

It's also possible there are some easy and simple web store hosts in the net, but probably one has to pay a bit to use their services.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: re:
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Please learn how to use a "full stop" or "period". Reading that post was painful.[hr][/quote]

jeez, yowzy you always have to give me a hard time don't you? besides it's not my fault i can't use a full stop or period nor is it my fault i have trouble captializing lettersRorie

title: Re: re:
content: found one called [url=http://www.opencart.com]opencart[/url], looks quite easy thanks keenrushRorie

title: Re: re:
content:
Proper spelling and grammar are vital, both for colloquial use and in the modern business world. They are part of the grease that oils civilisation's axle and we should always at least attempt them.
